image.altText: Two ambulance vehicles.

items.synopsis: Ten people have died and multiple others have been injured in a bus crash in the NSW Hunter, with emergency services called to Wine Country Drive at Greta just after 11.30pm on Sunday.

title.children: 10 people die in Hunter Valley crash after bus rolls off roundabout

image.altText: Ambulances attend a scene by the road in the dark.

items.synopsis: At least 10 people have died and multiple others have been injured in a bus crash in the NSW Hunter last night. Follow live.

title.children: Hunter bus crash will send 'shockwaves' through the region, mayor says

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Police say the coach rolled on a roundabout near the Hunter Expressway. Wine Country Drive is closed in both directions in Branxton, between the New England Highway and Bridge Street. Motorists have been advised to avoid the area and use an alternative route. Live Traffic NSW says there is no access to Wine Country Drive from the Hunter Expressway. The road closures are expected to be in place for some time.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Wine Country Drive is closed in both directions

children.content: Police say the coach rolled on a roundabout near the Hunter Expressway.

props.alt: A map of the accident site.

children.content: (ABC News)
Wine Country Drive is
closed in both directions in Branxton, between the New England Highway and Bridge Street.
Motorists have been advised to avoid the area and use an alternative route.
Live Traffic NSW says there is no access to Wine Country Drive from the Hunter Expressway.
The road closures are expected to be in place for some time.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: ABC Radio Sydney spoke to Cessnock Mayor Jay Suvaal earlier, who called the fatal bus crash "devastating news." "It's something I'm sure will be sending shock waves through the Hunter Valley community," he said. "It appears to have happened on the off ramp on to Wine Country Drive coming off the Hunter Expressway there. So there's a large roundabout across the Hunter Expressway and ramps on and off in either direction. "My understanding is that there's been multiple helicopters attending and paramedics on site as well as a huge emergency response from police and traffic control making sure that they could do what they could for the people involved."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Cessnock Mayor says bus crash 'will send shockwaves' through community

children.content: ABC Radio Sydney spoke to Cessnock Mayor
Jay Suvaal
earlier, who called the fatal bus crash "devastating news."
"It's something I'm sure will be sending shock waves through the Hunter Valley community," he said.

"It appears to have happened on the off ramp on to Wine Country Drive coming off the Hunter Expressway there. So there's a large roundabout across the Hunter Expressway and ramps on and off in either direction.

"My understanding is that there's been multiple helicopters attending and paramedics on site as well as a huge emergency response from police and traffic control making sure that they could do what they could for the people involved."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Emergency services were called to the site of the crash in Greta, NSW, just after 11:30pm. Police say a coach bus rolled on the roundabout on Wine Country Drive near the Hunter Expressway. At least 10 people have died, with 11 others taken to hospital. Another 18 passengers are reportedly uninjured. The bus driver — a 58-year-old man — has been taken to hospital under police guard for mandatory assessment. We'll bring you the latest updates as they come.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Ten people have died in a Hunter Valley bus crash

props.alt: A close-up photo of police headlights.

children.content: (ABC News: Dan Cox)
Emergency services were called to the site of the crash in
Greta, NSW
just after 11:30pm.
Police say
a coach bus rolled on the roundabout on Wine Country Drive
near the Hunter Expressway.
At least 10 people have died, with
11 others taken to hospital
Another 18 passengers are reportedly uninjured.
The bus driver — a 58-year-old man — has been taken to hospital under police guard
for mandatory assessment.
We'll bring you the latest updates as they come.
